H0.text: Gravitational is the force that causes the weight of an object to change because the weight of an object can change as a result of the force acting on that object.

H1.text: Electrical force is the force that can cause the weight of an object to change, because the weight of an object can vary depending on the force acting upon it.

H2.text: Magnetic force is the force that can cause the weight of an object to change, because the weight of an object can change when a force acts on that object.

H3.text: Friction is the force that causes the weight of an object to change because the weight of an object can change due to the force that acts on that object.

A4.text: The strength of the gravitational field is numerically equal to the acceleration of objects under its influence.

A5.text: The rate of acceleration of falling objects near the Earth's surface varies very slightly depending on latitude, surface features such as mountains and ridges, and perhaps unusually high or low sub-surface densities.
